metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:sharedresource_test probe is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:sharedresource_test probe.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

Information regarding the shared resources on your particular machine can be found by navigating to Start->Settings->Control Panel->Administrative Tools->Computer Management->System Tools->Shared Folders->Shares.

criterion.comment: Test that the sharedresource_object with netname equals is supported.
Test that the sharedresource_object with a netname pattern match is supported.
Test the sharedresource_object with the netname not equals is supported.

sharedresource_test.comment: Test that the sharedresource_object with netname equals is supported.
Test that the sharedresource_object with a netname pattern match is supported.
Test the sharedresource_object with the netname not equals is supported.

sharedresource_object.comment: This object represents a sharedresource_object with a netname equal to 'IPC$'.
This object represents a sharedresource_object with a netname that matches the regular expression '(.)+\$'.
This object represents a sharedresource_object with a netname that is not equal to 'IPC$'.

sharedresource_state.comment: This sharedresource_state represents a sharedresource_object with a netname equal to 'IPC$', a shared_type that matches the regular expression 'STYPE_[A-Z]+(_[A-Z]+)?(_[A-Z]+)?(_[A-Z]+)?', a max_uses greater than or equal to '0', a current_uses greater than or equal to '0', and a local_path that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This sharedresource_state represents a sharedresource_object with a netname that matches the regular expression '(.)+\$', a shared_type that matches the regular expression 'STYPE_[A-Z]+(_[A-Z]+)?(_[A-Z]+)?(_[A-Z]+)?', a max_uses greater than or equal to '0', a current_uses greater than or equal to '0', and a local_path that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This sharedresource_state represents a sharedresource_object with a netname that does not equal 'IPC$', a shared_type that matches the regular expression 'STYPE_[A-Z]+(_[A-Z]+)?(_[A-Z]+)?(_[A-Z]+)?', a max_uses greater than or equal to '0', a current_uses greater than or equal to '0', and a local_path that matches the regular expression '.*'.

constant_variable.comment: This variable utilizes the work-around to use the pattern match operation on an enumeration. This variable is referenced in the state 'oval:org.mitre.oval.test:ste:706', 'oval:org.mitre.oval.test:ste:1135', and 'oval:org.mitre.oval.test:ste:1111'
